We enjoined the small beer garden.  We did not use the pool or spa but it looked nice from the exterior.  The hotel is across from a small pass through retail area with a grocery store for odds and ends,  It was about a 20-25 minute walk to the edge of Old Town.  I see some negative reviews about staff/service but honestly we didn't experience any of that.  Our check in was handled by Viking so we would have missed any front desk

hotelName:

review_body: My „go-to“ hotel when I am in Prague. I got a newly renovated suite on the top floor assigned. The lounge Substitution next to the restaurant had a nice selection of drinks, cookies and fruits at daytimes but in the evening for the Happy Hour just a very simple and low quality food offering, the Hilton Prague Old Town did this quite better in comparison.  Otherwise I am looking forward to be back soon, thanks again

review_body: I can’t fault this hotel at all. I stayed for two nights and the staff were really friendly, the rooms quiet and clean, the location is good and within walking distance to the old town centre. I particularly liked the elevator design where you select your destination and it assigns you an elevator. The lobby is very well designed and makes the interior of the hotel feel really spacious. It is however quite a walk to your room if the room is on the opposite side from the elevators, which can be a little annoying. A second set of elevators would have been helpful. I didn’t have food in the hotel, but it appears like there are plenty of options.

review_body: We came to Prague for my wife’s 40th and it was fantastic. It’s difficult to choose a hotel when you have never been to a city so I picked one of the handful of 5 star hotels to make sure we got something nice. It’s unbelievably clean, almost like it only opened yesterday and the staff are great. Excellent location right near all the great old town sights and also beside the mall and a tram stop and metro. Perfect hotel for a city break and the restaurant is amazing too. I think the only other hotel I looked at staying in is the Hotel Paris another 5 star but I was really happy with this and if you like modern clean it’s perfect.

I'd like to thank the chambermaid as she was super friendly and our room was always cleaned spotlessly. Breakfast is plentiful and overall good, although I cannot not mention that eggs, sausages and bacon were stone cold every day. I got a complimentary bottle of sparkling wine on my birthday, along with a birthday card which was a nice touch. Thank you! :) The hotel is located in walking distance from every major attraction. I can’t say enough about what a wonderful stay I had.

Big thumbs up to all at the Cosmopolitan !!!!

review_body: One of the best hotels you can stay at in Prague. Especially during covid the prices are an amazing bargain. You can tell that whoever is managing this hotel is doing a great job as the service is always professional, kind, and helpful.
hotelName:

review_body: This hotel is what dreams are made of! Perfect location near Charles Bridge and walking distance from Old town. We were upgraded to a river facing room as we celebrated our wedding anniversary . The reception staff especially Yetisirah was exceptionally sweet , helpful and kind in every way .. we are big travellers and her hospitality will be long remembered. Table reservations for dinner , suggestions on how and where to go ; all offered without asking and proved very helpful Marian, David and Aleksandra were very helpful too. Comfy 4 poster bedroom. The two courtyards are pretty and reminder of the old palace. Wellness spa is limited. The spread and service at breakfast was exceptional to the highest of standards . They even iron the tablecloths after laying them on the table

review_body: Simply the most welcoming hotel we’ve stayed in; really exceptional. The room was big, spotless, and finished to a high standard. The location is well balanced, with Old Town and Charles Bridge only a short walk, but the river and views of the castle are a lovely feature from the front of the hotel. The breakfast is first class and I even overheard the next table discussing how there was a wonderful variety. My wife and I had the Eggs Benedict and I can warmly recommend it. All in all this hotel is outstanding and we will look forward to returning on our next visit. Fortunately this will only be in a few months time.

Our room was large and very very clean, the bed linen was white and well cared for, the bathroom was spotless, we had a TV and fridge if needed. Fresh towels and sheets each day,  toiletries and tea and coffee. Breakfast was served between 7.30 and 10 each day it was fresh and hot.  coffee choice of tea and juices and cold buffet  breads and pastries. there was something for even the fussy eaters it was fantastic. Thank you Iron Gate Hotel and Suites for the best time.

It was good value (around £80/night) and we’d happily stay again, but you’re not getting a 5* hotel like a Kimpton or Intercontinental (albeit the rooms here are much more spacious than those chains). Good breakfast, though busy if you sit downstairs - they definitely need a second coffee machine! All in all, definitely recommended.

Some highlights:  - Food: the kosher food is delicious (scrumptious breakfast, lobby cafe with the most delicious pizza and meaty dining for dinner) . the lobby cafe is open until 22:00 which was great as we got to eat after we got back from the Opera.  At breakfast you can order sandwiches to be packed for lunch for only 5€.  - Rooms: the room was newly renovated, comfortable beds, very nice and strong shower room.  - Spa: the steamroom was the perfec relaxation after a long day of walking. With the most cozy lounge to relax in, great place to unwind.  - The hotel is beautiful! It’s old original features add so much charm to this European experience.

hotelName:
23    Hotel King David

review_body: This hotel never disappoints. We stayed for a week, with half-board. For the price, we got great value! The food was varied, plentiful, fresh, and tasty. We felt very welcomed when we received a personal cake to our room for the occasion of our anniversary with a beautiful card from the hotel management.  The staff was very helpful, especially when we had a medical emergency to deal with. The room and the amenities were delightful. Were stayed in the Deluxe room. It was nice and new, spacious and pleasant. Everything we needed was provided promptly. The location was comfortable - a short walk from the old city square and the Palladium shopping center as well as other attractions. It was a perfect Prague experience!

This hotel situated in historical central in the old, well-preserved building. So we really enjoyed that! What are some wooden doors at the entrance, which set a great mood with their beauty! Room was clean, no questions.  After check-in we didn’t find bathrobes in the room, and “welcome bottle of water” was half empty. But hotel stuff decide these issues instantly. And off course I couldn’t miss absolutely amazing bed which are the best after long walks! It was very very comfortable for sleeping.  Hotel situated in 10-15 min walk from the Staromestskaya (old town) square and 45 min walk from “Prague castle”. We recommend this hotel in Prague!

Would have given 6 stars if 5 were not the max!

review_body: Great location.  It is close to everything from tourist attractions to restaurants shops. Very nice and modern apartment. Very friendly and helpful lady at the reception, when questioned something about my booking. Enjoyed staying here.

review_body: This was my second stay in here. And because I really liked it first time, I came back.  This my my room was on the 4th floor and heading to the street. Room was nice, spacy, with very good mattress on the bed (very firm, definitely not the cheap spring one) Quite noisy in the night, so I had to close windows during the night. But that's acceptable in this location and it wasn't an issue for me. The only real issue I had with this room was the cigarette smell. I could feel it all the time more or less. And it was even more noticable in the bed. It was room 402. When I was there last time in room 301, it was odourless.  I think that sticker with no smoking sign isn't enough to prevent some hard smokers from smoking.
hotelName:
51    Hotel Residence Spalena

review_body: Hotel as described, room on the 5th floor, hot in summer because in the attic, there is a fan and a free-standing air conditioning (very loud, not for night use), you can hear trams, but for a short stay it is ok. Staff exceptional! They speak English fluently, help at every stage of the booking, including the parking lot, and respond quickly to text messages. Close to the old town. Good food. It's worth buying dinner in the restaurant!
hotelName:
51    Hotel Residence Spalena

review_body: Absolutely brilliant location, right in the centre and easy to walk to everything. hotelName:
52    Hotel AURUS

hotelName:
52    Hotel AURUS

hotelName:
52    Hotel AURUS

review_body: The hotel is situated in the most beautiful area of Prague, just a minute walk from Vltava river and the popular Charles Bridge. I can't imagine better location in the city. hotelName:

review_body: I highly recommend Hotel LeonD'Oro!  Me and my family enjoyed staying here so much. Upon arrival we were greeted with a nice atmosphere and helpful staff. The hotel and the room we stayed in were perfectly clean! The breakfast was delicious with a wide range of selection. I would like to give many thanks to lady Ľubka. She was very nice, always smiling and willing! She definitely knows her way around. We will surely visit again!
hotelName:

review_body: Exceptional stay as this hotel has everything you would want at a fair price.  We were three adults who booked the Junior Suite with Terrace. This was a two-level, two full bathroom unit with a kitchenette. The terrace was nothing less of perfection. We used it every day as the view over Prague was so beautiful. The breakfast buffet was also excellent. We especially liked that there were different options every day. Hats off to the chef for surprising us with new choices every morning, many of them vegetarian!  The location of this hotel could not better!  The staff was professional and the restaurant staff friendly. Cannot complain about anything here. Would…and WILL…stay here again!
hotelName:

review_body: Our home in Prague, a wonderful hotel, amazing staff, huge, clean and air-conditioned rooms. Our room was with two balconies, the highest top in the city center, except for the cathedral spiers. Amazing view. But the thing that makes it home is the wonderful staff. Sure go back there and only there. Must note that I was already in King Court in a suite with a balcony. But back, I will only return to leon doro
hotelName:

review_body: The hotel itself was excellent, room was large and comfortable, there was a kettle in the room. The breakfast was extremely good and the hotel location excellent (but difficult to navigate to due to the Prague road system and roadworks)   I would have scored the hotel higher had it not been for their bad booking confirmation and lengthy delays in responding to messages. The hotel advertises Free Parking on-site which is the reason we booked the hotel. Immediately upon booking we sent a message to the hotel to confirm the reservation for a parking space, we did not receive a reply so sent a second message, finally received a reply only 90 minutes before our arrival, whilst on the road, stating, a parking space was not available. This did not give us time to find alternative hotel

Breakfast was a great selection of fruit/pastries/toast/muesli which was served in the hallway to take back to your room to eat. Staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is easy to find/get to from the airport, 5mins walk from Malostranska Metro station on line A so ~35mins door-to-door if you catch the timing right. It's located on the "quiet" side of the river, so not too touristy, but still with lots of great restaurants and shops around and still 5mins walk from both Charles Bridge and the Castle.
hotelName:

review_body: This apartment was perfect. No when I say perfect I mean location, facilities, ease of check in and checkout. Everything  We arrived on Thursday evening and were shown to the apartment by the host. The apartment has an open plan main room with double bed, sofa, tv, fireplace, and dining area and large earlobe, there is a seperate kitchen and bathroom area and a utility area with washing machine.  The location is close to the Charles bridge (5 mins walk)  so can cross easily in the Prague centre it is also close to the Lennon wall.  We received a discount for food and drinks in the downstairs restaurant which we used twice.  Will be returning for sure
hotelName:

review_body: This place was very nice and has a location that is simply unrivaled in Prague.   It was great for the price -- which we obtained with an advance-booking discount. The only thing to keep in mind is that parking is far away, about 7 mins walk and can be brutal in sub zero temps in winter especially if you have lots of bags.  Otherwise the location cant be more perfect.   Breakfast is cold but there is great cafe called cafe 22 right outside where you can hop in jammies. They open at 7am. review_body: We loved everything about the Charles Bridge Palace Hotel in Prague. The room was lovely and clean, and we had an amazing view of the Vltava River. And the breakfast was great with an excellent selection of hot and cold dishes and fresh pastries. The hotel is located very close to the Charles Bridge, so it is easy walking distance to all the historic sites.  The only bad thing about the area is there is a disco-bar on the ground floor facing the river, and they play super loud disco-music all night long (so we had to sleep with ear-plugs, and even then could still hear the loud beat).

The hotel is also walking distance from a good shopping centre and a choice of restaurants. Everyone observed Covid rules and my stay was stress free.  I travelled to Prague alone, again due to Covid but felt safe and secure the whole time. The hotel, staff and cost were wonderful.  I will definitely return to this hotel and can't fault it.  Thank you.

review_body: Cannot recommend Hotel U Prince enough!   Fairy tale ambience but with all the modern conveniences.   Wonderful location.   Step outside and you’re in the middle of Old Town.  The staff is warm and welcoming and ready to assist with anything you need.  Martina in Reception took us under her wing with recommendations and even COVID testing scheduling.   When we needed help with charging cable, Edward in Reception hunted through his box of cords to find some hat would work.  The breakfast was ample and the setting was comfortable and friendly.  The Black Angels bar staff was eager to serve just the right cocktail according to our tastes.   The Teresa rooftop restaurant was lovely with delicious food and stunning views.   All in all, a great stay in a very unique hotel.

The restaurant where breakfast was served was large and bright thanks to the partially glass ceiling. Breakfast was basic but good.  The stay at this hotel was very pleasant.
hotelName:
76    Boutique Hotel Seven Days
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel looks very stylish and is well maintained. The service of the reception was very thoughtful and kind. And above all, not expensive. All of this not far from the city centre. The breakfast was average/good (quality good, but not everything was replenished straight away).
hotelName:
76    Boutique Hotel Seven Days
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for a night. Due to COVID there are not too many tourists around so this place also was relatively quiet. The interior is very nice, reception and service excellent. Beds provided good sleep quality. Breakfast was good, probably better than local average but not stellar. Very reasonable and pleasant place that I can recommend.
hotelName:
76    Boutique Hotel Seven Days
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked this hotel for our wedding anniversary, through Expedia Canada 1.5 months prior stay date. We have also paid for it at the time of booking. When we arrived at the hotel and called them to allow us to park in the court yard, we were told that our reservation was cancelled apparently by us. We couldn't have done that because our reservation was through Expedia. Then, they said another tour operator that deals with Exepedia cancelled it. Funny enough, on Expedia's site our reservation showed as in progress. We called them in Canada, spent an hour on the phone and all our roaming minutes, and they had no clue what happened to our reservation.  Since, we arrived at the hotel, I managed to talk to 2 people by phone, who gave us contradicting info. Finally, it seems the hotel
hotelName:
77    Hotel Monastery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Outstanding service, unbelievable food good, plenty of beverages to choose from, nice and cosy ambience. The whole premises was so cleaned, well maintained, decorated with good colors  I will return with friends and family very soon.keep doing a good job.
hotelName:
77    Hotel Monastery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Small hotel in one of the nicest parts of old Prague. Very well licared. Prague castle in walking distance. Historical building, nicely reno vated, cozy rooms. Tasty breakfast. Pets allowed. Will definitely come back.
hotelName:
77    Hotel Monastery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: One of our favoutiute hotels - anywhere. Always happy to return to this lovely hotel. Staff helpful, Location great with the bonus of having excellent beer and food available within the monastery complex also. A pleaseure to stay there and again, we shall be back!!
hotelName:
77    Hotel Monastery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my wife and my first trip to Prague. We wanted to stay somewhere special and peaceful with a good location to sightsee from. We couldn't have agreed on a better Hotel. The staff was amazing and friendly, the breakfast buffet was excellent and many options. Beautiful location on top of the hill with a great view of the city and just a 5-7 minute walk to Prague Castle. We definitely recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
77    Hotel Monastery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in Sophie downtown just for one night but had very good experience..nice room..Good choices of breakfast..room supplies was enough..very clean..and friendly staff..will come back for sure..and also recommend to friends and family..
hotelName:
78    Miss Sophie's New Town
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is amazing hostel as describe in title. Definitely suitable for backpacker/traveler. The common area is very spacious and I'd spent wonderful time to meet all the travelers around the world.   The room is quit clean, bright and comfortable.
hotelName:
78    Miss Sophie's New Town
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very stylish, but not overpriced at all. Great location, within a 10 mins walk to river side. Excellent for a morning run, and with local transport of trams and train very close. beer Bar next door, was also fantastic. Cleaning top notch, staff extremely helpful and friendly, especially upon checking in, with a thorough run thru of map and recommendations. Only criticism would be that the room got extremely hot and we had to open windows regularly, even with heaters turned down and it about 7 degrees outside. Overall, a lovely place to stay 4 nights exploring one of the most beautiful cities. Would definitely recommend.
hotelName:
78    Miss Sophie's New Town
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I had a wonderful 4 night stay.  I could tell that the owner truly cared about creating a special place.  Very well done, artistic, comfortable, clean, modern, warm, and cozy design.  The private spa was a treat!
hotelName:
78    Miss Sophie's New Town
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is such a pretty little hotel..rooms are lovely..good location although but of walking involved to get to the centre but near the transport links if you can figure them out . Breakfast so so. Staff pleasent and helpful
hotelName:
78    Miss Sophie's New Town
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was the worst experience I have ever had. The receptionist was so rude and really doesnt hear what he says. The services is the worst ever. They dont keep their words.   We went for spa and massage, actually we prepaid. But, they said we cannot provide massage eventhough we got an appointment before 1 week.   I havent seen this kind of service and people in any country. Shocked!!!
hotelName:
79    Euroagentur Hotel Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Awesome hotel,  Rooms are lovely with tea and coffee making facilities, hairdryer, flat screen TV with a couple of English News Channels.  Staff are very friendly.  The hotel is within easy walking distance from all attractions.
hotelName:
79    Euroagentur Hotel Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel Is nothing what they claim. It’s most definitely not a 4 star. It’s run down, old furniture, horrible rude staff! They claim to have air conditioners but they are blowers that don’t cool. Upon them checking, they said the outside and inside temperature can not be too different! And the staff said “I feel it’s working” & I cant do anything. Worst experience ever!
hotelName:
79    Euroagentur Hotel Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First of all it is nothing next to 4 star hotel ! There is no proper service. They have no concept of room cleaning , after a whole day of being outside when we returned back to the room , it hadn’t been cleaned , they had not changed the towels or the cups. When asked they said they don’t have a policy for changing it. When asked for shaving kit it wasn’t free and they charged us. Breakfast was average.  The only saving grace is the free WiFi !
hotelName:
79    Euroagentur Hotel Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’m now checking out from this hotel and have no others words than a big thank you. Great personal that always offers to do a bit extra for the guests. If you visit Prag and want a nice clean hotel with good standard, I can recommend this to you with a warm heart.
hotelName:
79    Euroagentur Hotel Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a fantastic hotel, modern spacious rooms with the best shower i've ever used, and wonderful helpful staff especially the receptionists who provided us with loads of useful information to enjoy our stay in Prague,hope to visit again first class.
hotelName:
80    Chevron Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A brilliant hotel on the outskirts of the city. It is very modern and comfortable. The staff were very helpful throughout our stay, helping us book a tour; thanks Julia!  Rooms are spotlessly clean and the bed was very comfortable.  Woukd highly recommend to anyone.
hotelName:
80    Chevron Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our room was so new, the baseboards had not been completed !  Nor was there anywhere to put our suitcases or even a chair.  Having said that, the staff did their best to help us and a new chair was forthcoming - so new it still had the ticket on it.  The room and shower room are both very modern - they could do with some hooks on the back of the doors and a shelf in the shower.  The bed was the most comfortable of our Europe trip and the TV gigantic !!!  The young Reception staff were extremely friendly and helpful and, when they heard it was my birthday, printed out a delightful card and gave it to me with some chocolates - much appreciated ! You have to go outside in the morning to walk a short way to the Red and Blue Design Hotel for breakfast - OK if the weather is good !!!
hotelName:
80    Chevron Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've stayed for a week and it was perfect vacation cause staff helped me to solve my "little troubles" and make everything to make my stay better. The room was tidy and nice. I'm very demanding on cleanliness but here I had nothing to complain about. I'll come here again for sure!!!
hotelName:
80    Chevron Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A wonderful hotel that meets all the necessary requirements for a good rest and work. Very good design, where the convenience and comfort of guests are the main priorities. Well trained staff. I believe that the owners of all hotels in the Czech Republic should use such hotels as a model.
hotelName:
80    Chevron Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked this as restrictions were easing for December 2021.  However the week before we were due to arrive both Czech and UK governments started reintroducing restrictions which got more severe as the week went on. We complied with everything but the day before departure further restrictions were introduced requiring negative Covid tests within 48 hours before return to the UK.  We slept on it but the consequences of 1 of us proving positive and having to isolate alone abroad for 10 days was just too much of a risk.  We wouldn't know our results until the day we were meant to return so wouldn't be relaxed at all during our stay.  We are both Key workers at home and just couldn't risk it so we decided not to go accepting we would be out of pocket.  Nothing we could do about the
hotelName:
81    Hotel Golden Star
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Absolutely loved our stay here last week. The staff are very friendly and helpful and the rooms are exceptional. The breakfast was very nice and the restaurant is very clean. Can’t wait to return here one day soon.
hotelName:
81    Hotel Golden Star
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: AMAZING location nestled in the castle district. The streets are filled with tourists during the day and by night it’s so quiet you can hear a pin drop. The hotel is clean and the staff is friendly and accommodating. Unfortunately we didn’t get the best sleep here as we could hear the guests below us in the late hours of the night.
hotelName:
81    Hotel Golden Star
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean, modern and very comfortable, the Golden Star is at the same time part of Old Prague: a beautiful house with baroque stucco work just under the Castle, and (we were in Room 44) the most spectacular view over the city. The people were lovely, and the buffet breakfast was delcious with great coffee. We wanted to try the restaurant; but after having sat for ten minutes at lunch time with no one even bothering to welcome us, we went elsewhere.
hotelName:
81    Hotel Golden Star
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at Golden Star Hotel in Prague for 5 nights. Only a few minutes' walk to Castle, the hotel was modern but historical at the same time, with welcoming staff members. I got one of the best rooms on the 4th floor  - an impressive view. The reason for my "very good", not "excellent", rating was breakfast. Coffee was ok, but bread was almost inedible. Too dry. The choice was also very limited.
hotelName:
81    Hotel Golden Star
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked at Belvedere many times, especially when being on business trip, on the occasion of Prague Book Fair, organized in the exhibition centre, walking distance. A very clean, quiet and comfortable hotel, and the personnel is always very helpful. Delicious breakfast!
hotelName:
82    Hotel Belvedere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Belvedere is my favourite hotel in Prague. Last stay was in December 2019. That was my boyfriend's Birthday, so we were placed in beautiful room, brought sparkling wine and allowed to order a fruit plate. So my boyfriend is in love with the hotel too, we are waiting for our next trip to Prague - of course (and only) in Belvedere.
hotelName:
82    Hotel Belvedere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here with my boyfriend, two nights and enjoyed it really much. It is close to the center, just 5 minutes away from trams and it is so convinient!  The breakfast was included and we enjoyed it - even tho my boyfriend was a bit disappointed that there was no bacon haha.  overall, the experience was good. The only downside was that they did not refill the coffee capsules in the hotel room, and i had just one coffee, the day of arrival - bit disappointed by that - i love coffee too much and the coffee from the room was way better than the one from the breakfast buffet.
hotelName:
82    Hotel Belvedere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel in a great location close to old town with nice friendly staff and nice breakfast every morning catering to everybody’s needs.  I also received a free bottle of champagne on my birthday.  Five stars from me.
hotelName:
82    Hotel Belvedere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: In Belvedere, I enjoyed my relaxing time and great service. The rooms were very clean. The staff was very polite and friendly. The transport from airport was organized smoothly! In addition, the hotel's breakfast, restaurant,  and café were very nice! Here, I could pay by card, or cash. I could exchange money at the hotel, too. The location of the hotel is great. It is close for everything. Really nice area!
hotelName:
82    Hotel Belvedere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Near the airport and probably 15-20 minute walk. Shuttle bus but did not use. Small at park but spaces always available. Room is good and well appointed. Breakfast buffet is good as is the restaurant in the evening. Prefer the Marriott that is 2 minutes walk from terminal and car hire but more expensive
hotelName:
83    Holiday Inn Prague Airport, an IHG hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a fine place to stay at Prague airport. They have their own shuttle on call which arrives in minutes after you place a call at their own booth in the arrival hall (after customs). The rooms are clean and well equiped. They serve a decent breakfast and the staff is friendly and helpfull.
hotelName:
83    Holiday Inn Prague Airport, an IHG hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Vary bad attitude of the entire staff, this is the most flaw of the hotel. The blond girl at the reception stands out above all for rudeness and more (hi btch, yes is me). Following room are quite good (typical Holiday Inn style, no more no less) but the cleanliness is not so good. I’ve found woman used underwear lost in a corner, good for a  fetishist guest, not for me.  Good for me just one night there.
hotelName:
83    Holiday Inn Prague Airport, an IHG hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is very close to the airport and has a shuttle that can take you there. The breakfast was also very delicious with a wide array of options. When I was trying to sleep I would hear noise from another room, but other than that the stay was good.
hotelName:
83    Holiday Inn Prague Airport, an IHG hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arrived fairly late in the evening.  Easy to find from the airport. Warm welcome.  Room (IHG member room) was fine. Restaurant food and service was good in the evening.  Had pate and salad as a light meal. Breakfast - a lot of choice, good quality.   Didn’t like a loose dog being in the breakfast room for breakfast. Shouldn’t be allowed - dogs if allowed, should be on a lead. I would come back here - very good for an airport hotel.
hotelName:
83    Holiday Inn Prague Airport, an IHG hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Modern, interesting and very clean apartment. Would recomend for business trip. We were suprised with bottle of prosseco in apartment. Great breakfast in the hotel 20m away. Svetlana were very polite and service were great. Hi Svetlana!
hotelName:
84    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was  visiting Prague for the first time on a solo trip for 3 nights, I couldn't have chosen a better place to stay.  The apartment is very comfortable, clean, well furnished, conveniently located 10 minutes from the center. When I entered the apartment, I was welcomed by a bottle of prosecco, sitting on ice, ready to be drink and a warm note from the staff, which just made it a perfect start for my weekend away.  On the first floor you have a beautiful spa with wonderful services , I got myself a massage before heading to the airport. Plenty restaurants, cafes , bars and wine bars around , 5 minutes walking from the dancing house .  The staff is very helpful, cordial and knowledgeable, they even helped me making my appointment for pre-departure test.  Absolutely 100%
hotelName:
84    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a 1 bedroom appartment and the stay was amazing. You need to check in at the hotel next door (mosaic hotel) and after that you can have a relaxed stay in a well organized appartment.   The room gets cleaned daily and they even tidy it up a bit. You can have breakfast from Mosaic hotel, but it’s a bit pricey so we decided to eat in small local restaurants. We can really recommend ‘Milano’ a great Italy place with good coffee and sandwiches.   The staff was very friendly and you can park right outside the hotel for 400 czk a day. You can pay with check out.   The appartment itself was great, it was pretty big and had everything it needed. We can recommended everyone to stay here
hotelName:
84    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in one bedroom apartment initially for 5 days but we loved the place so we extended for 2 more. Everything was perfect, apartment is well equipped with all what you need. Staff is available 24/7 always happy to help. Great for business trip or Prague exploration.  Unfortunately there is no AC however each room has little transferrable cooler.
hotelName:
84    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here last week for my bussines trip, i had one bedroom apartment and i have to say it was imazing stay, my 3 days in Prague, last two days was very hot but in the apartment was AC so the air was perfcet,there is kitchen i didnt cook but it was fully furnished, and coffee for FREE at the apartment and welcome drink ( bottle of cool Prosecco for free ) What a service !!! Bathroom is very cool and luxury, bed was just imazing i didnt want go out of bed and go for work. The staff very profesionall, i did check in MOSAIC HOUSE ( just few steps from MOOo and how i was informed is sister hotel of MOOo Apartments ) and WAIT i was there maybe 3 y.a.g but i saw that hotel is now after renovation and this i have to say it is like GEM in all Prague!! For my next trip i definitely
hotelName:
84    MOOo Downtown

review_body: This hotel is a lovely place in the heart of Prague, very close to the top atractions including Prague castle and Carls Bridge. The location is just priceless.   We really enjoyed our stay despite the fact we were woken up by the tram at 5AM. Next morning we asked the receptionist to switch our room and she did this right away. We originally booked the superior room with the bathtub and garden view but ended up in the deluxe room with the view to the Castle. I can just assume they wanted to offer us an upgrade… but if you dont want to be woken up by the tram make sure to get the “garden” view!!!   The bed was comfortable with a great selection of pillows but none of them of the normal size of pillow just one great one and several tiny ones. The hotel itself is pretty loud, with
hotelName:

review_body: We were rally happy with our room, and the view was amazing. The location of this hotel is amazing, close to everything. Loved it and would recommend it for sure. The staff are helpful. The breakfast was really good. we loved our stay.
hotelName:
85    Hotel Klarov
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our favourite hotel where I am regurarly coming back. I just recommend to enlarge the offer at the breakfast. Nice but busy view to the castle and very quiet view to "garden" of government. Clean rooms.
hotelName:
85    Hotel Klarov
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is just at the better place to visit Prague. Everything is reachable walking in a very short time. Beautifull view of the castle from our room. The staff is really taking care. Breakfast is excellent. I  highly recommand !
hotelName:
85    Hotel Klarov
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was in a great location, with a view of the Prague Castle out of our window.  Classic older building, but meticulously clean, and updated.  The room was very nice with a large modern updated bathroom.  The folks working there were very friendly and attentive.  And the included breakfast was outstanding - varied and fresh and constantly refreshed by the staff.  This was not necessarily a hotel I would have chosen - it was a meeting place for a trip we were on - but we are certainly glad we did.  Cannot recommend highly enough.
hotelName:
85    Hotel Klarov
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is very new, it actually smells like new furniture!! Very very central, more than what it looks like from the maps: around 5 minutes away from the old town square! The room is clean and the bathroom very comfortable. Breakfast is good, however it has more sweet than savory choices (albeit cheese, ham, egg, sausage, salami and fresh vegetable are available!) Due to COVID-19 you need to inform the reception daily if you want your room cleaned everyday! Very hard to set the right temperature inside the room, you may end up with a boiling hot room throughout the night (but better warm than cold!)
hotelName:
86    The Gold Bank Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel has nice architecture, you feel luxurious yet you know you’re staying at a city hotel. I like the location, it is pretty much central and the main railway station is just around the corner. The negative for me was the staff - they barely spoke czech despite operating in Czech Republic, all of them were ukrainian or russian to my guess. We were sent to a room where somebody was staying in - not very pleasant but mistakes happen. The rooms were quite small, at least the one we got. However, breakfast was great. I was expecting some continental choices, but it pleasantly surprised me. Selection was wide and you will definitely not leave hungry.
hotelName:
86    The Gold Bank Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved the hotel! The room was very neat and tidy, the service was absolutely great! The value for money is payfull! Highly recommended! We loved the design of the room. And the location is absolutely great if you want to be near the old city but not exactly in the middle.
hotelName:
86    The Gold Bank Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I absolutely fell in love with this hotel! Very nice modern design, very clean, everything is so new. Great location suitable for business trip and exploring city as well. Very helpful front desk with wonderful individual approach was very much appreciated! 👏
hotelName:
86    The Gold Bank Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was nice but not fully finished; the minibar was missing, it was a big surprise! The worst experience was the breakfast. Very basic, staff was not present, coffee was not a real coffee, tables were not ready for breakfast... Horrible!!!!!   I was excited to come and stay at this hotel, but after one night, I'm happy to leave!
hotelName:
86    The Gold Bank Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely hotel in the best location for the old town square and Christmas markets, when there open that is. Spacious rooms with a safe , iron & ironing board and tea and coffee making facilities.  Super comfortable beds with fresh towels every day. Good sized bathroom with hairdryer. After walking round Prague for a few days and realised that we had struck gold with Hotel Rott.  Staff were excellent, polite and helpful.  The breakfast was always good with lots and lots of choice.  We all said,  that next time we go back to Prague our first choice will definitely be Hotel Rott. Brilliant experience.
hotelName:
87    Hotel Rott
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed (three couples) at the ROTT Hotel on 26-30 / 11 The hotel is in a stunning location, 20 meters from the Old Town Square with access to all major sites. The rooms are renovated, spacious, clean and very luxurious. Breakfast is excellent. And most importantly - an amazing team !!! I have never come across a hotel whose staff is so pleasant and helpful that does everything to help and to the satisfaction of the guests. We will mention in particular JANA who took care of all the details and excellent hospitality and PAVEL who assisted us in all needs (including COVID19 vaccination certificates).
hotelName:
87    Hotel Rott
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is very nice hotel and it has very good location. All staffs are very kind and also General Manager Madam Jana Budinska is very very helpful and kind. Rooms are very clean and silent. Next time this hotel will be only choice for us. Many thanks…
hotelName:
87    Hotel Rott
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic hotel perfect location just near the astronomical clock lovely clean rooms and the staff were really helpful breakfast was lovely  Would love to return as soon as things get back to normal we went Feb 2019 and haven't had chance to return yet
hotelName:
87    Hotel Rott

review_body: הזמנתי 5 לילות לסוף מרץ, האירוח בוטל בגלל הקורונה. גברת ג'אנה בודינסקה נהגה באחריות וביושר והשיבה לנו את כל התשלום ששילמנו. עם יחס נעים והוגן שכזה מצד הנהלת המלון, אני בטוחה שכשנגיע לפראג, נתארח במלון רוט.  I booked a 5 night stay for the end of March. Unfortunately the accommodation was canceled because of the corona. Mrs. Jana Bodinska, acted with great responsibility and honesty when she returned to us the full payment we had paid. With such a pleasant and fair treatment from the hotel management, I am sure that when we arrive in Prague, we will be staying at the
hotelName:
87    Hotel Rott

review_body: If you are traveling around Czech look no further! This hostel is a hidden gem! I’ve have just finished my visit to Prague and I am so happy I’ve booked this hostel.  The staff ( Alex, Paul and their sweet cleaning lady) were very professional, helpful and always available to react quickly to any request. Whether you come here for a few days or long term this is a great place to stay. As a solo traveler (female) I’ve always look for safety, cleanliness and value. Located in the middle of town in a historic building (be prepare to take a few stairs to your room/ no biggie for anyone regardless of your level of fitness. The most important highlight for me was that everything is literally walking distance from it. Plenty of restaurants and attractions to see. What else can I say,
hotelName:
88    Hostel Orange Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hospitality and contact with the owners of the hostel was great. Our room was nice and clean and there were lockers for valuable stuff. The hostel was at a nice location close to the train station and the center of the city.
hotelName:
88    Hostel Orange Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Me and a friend stayed at hostel orange for two nights and we had a very pleasant stay. The hostel is close to everything, the staff is very friendly and the place is clean. Everything you want for your stay in Prague!
hotelName:
88    Hostel Orange Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: They weren't so nice at anytime, sometimes it seems to be difficult to be a little nice. Also the deposit was 3 or 4 times higher than the cost of the dormitory. And to have only two showers and one WC for 20 people is not very good.
hotelName:
88    Hostel Orange Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is by far the best hostel I ever stayed at and the staff was really helpful in explaining and also guiding around Prague. The rooms were built beautifully and breakfast was partially available. Coffee was always available. Must place to stay if in Prague.
hotelName:
88    Hostel Orange Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I really have good memories from staying here. The young lady at the front desk was very helpful with directions and answering questions. I loved the location around the corner from the tram and a great vegan bistro restaurant. A good breakfast was included.
hotelName:
89    Hotel Tivoli
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our second time staying at this hotel in three months, having been here for the Christmas markets in December 2019. It probably says it all that we had no hesitation in coming back, as the hotel is ideally situated for the Old Town, being around 5 minutes walk from the top of Wenceslas Square and both Museum and I.P. Pavolva metro stations mere minutes away. The close proximity of Museum metro station makes it easy to get to from the airport.  The hotel staff were very friendly, the room was cleaned daily and the breakfast was plentiful, with scrambled eggs, bacon and sausages supplementing the usual continental breakfast fare.  All in all, a great little hotel in a beautiful city and we will certainly return.
hotelName:
89    Hotel Tivoli
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here in October 2018 with my three friends,  hotel was lovely , but just a tad far out , maybe a 25 to 30 minute walk to the centre, rooms were cleaned every day , and hotel was spotless.  Breakfast was just okay not much choice.  Done the boat tour and it was fab definitely try it.
hotelName:
89    Hotel Tivoli
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 2 nights here during our weekend in Prague and were very comfortable during that time. The hotel is located around 10 minutes walk away from the Old Town Square and has many restaurants and bars within a few minutes walk (we had some very good meals in places within the Namesti Miru area).  Hotel is very clean and our room was huge- so much space and almost everything you could need was provided (no tea making facilities in the room which would have been nice). There is a reasonably priced minibar in the room with soft drinks, water and various alcohols.  Breakfast is served from 7.30-10.30 each morning and has your usual continental selection as well as a few hot options. I really enjoyed the coffee.  Not the most modern hotel I’ve stayed in but I honestly cannot fault

review_body: The location is perfect, being around 5 minutes from Wenceslas Square, 2 minutes from the metro station and 10 minutes from the main train station. Staff were friendly and efficient, room was clean and breakfast plentiful, with 2 hot offerings (scrambled eggs and 1 other), along with the normal continental fare.  We stayed for 5 nights and found that everywhere we wanted to go - up to as far as the castle - was easily within walking distance of the hotel. Namesti Miru Christmas market is just around the corner, whilst the others are a short stroll in the other direction. All in all, a great little break in a magical setting to get you in the Christmas spirit. Perfect.

Metro takes 3 minutes and tram takes 6 minutes to the old town.
